etymology.description: 手(手) (shǒu, "hand") stylized as 又(又) (yòu, "again") holding two 禾(禾) (hé, "grain stalks") -> combines multiple things
etymology.interpretation: The character 兼(兼) (jiān, "hold together, combine") visually represents a hand holding two grain stalks, symbolizing the action of combining or holding multiple items together. This contrasts with 秉(秉) (bǐng, "handle"), which shows a hand holding a single plant, further emphasizing multiplicity in 兼(兼).

examples.chinese: 他身兼数职(他身兼數職)。
他在公司担任经理(他在公司擔任經理)，兼顾市场营销(兼顧市場營銷)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài gōngsī dānrèn jīnglǐ, jiān gù shìchǎng yíngxiāo.
examples.english: He works as a manager at the company, simultaneously overseeing marketing.

examples.chinese: 学校组织座谈会(學校組織座談會)，兼收师生意见(兼收師生意見)。
examples.pinyin: Xuéxiào zǔzhī zuòtán huì, jiān shōu shīshēng yìjiàn.
examples.english: The school organizes symposiums and also collects the opinions of teachers and students.
